column2: officially the Municipality of Trento (Cebuano: Lungsod sa Trento; Tagalog: Bayan ng Trento)
column3: is a 1st class municipality in the province of Agusan del Sur
column6: 565 people.Trento was formerly a barrio of Bunawan called Bahayan (referring to a lead sinker at the base of a fishing net). On June 15
column8: it became a separate municipality through Republic Act No.  5283. The town's name was derived from the Council of Trent.

column1: According to the Philippine Statistics Authority
column2: the municipality has a land area of 555.7 square kilometres (214.6 sq mi)  constituting 5.56% of the 9
column4: 856.98 sq mi) total area of Agusan del Sur.

column1: Trento is classified as Type II climate which has no dry season but with pronounced maximum rain period occurring from December to January.
Trento is politically subdivided into 16 barangays.

column3: 565. The population density was 93 inhabitants per square kilometre (240/sq mi).

column1: Its economy is dependent heavily on subsistence agriculture
